sentences.sentence: The old King told him to go to drive the geese( 鹅 ) next morning as usual, and he himself hid behind the gate and heard how the girl spoke to Falada.
Then he followed them into the fields, and hid himself behind a bush( 灌木 ) and watched the goose-boy and the goose-girl look after the geese.
After a while he saw the girl loosen( 松开 ) her hair all loose( 松散的 ), and how it shone with a golden light. Soon she said,
Wind, blow Conrad’s hat away—
Don’t stop the windy weather
Until I fix my hair
And get myself together.
Then there came a strong wind that blew away Conrad’s hat.
Conrad ran after it, while the girl combed( 梳理 ) and fastened( 系牢 ) up her hair.
The old King saw all that went on. At last he went away.
When the goose-girl came back in the evening he sent for her, and asked her to explain( 解释 ) why she had done all these things.
“I dare( 敢 ) not tell you,” she answered. “Nor can I tell any man of my sorrow( 痛苦 ). For when I was in danger of my life, I made a promise not to tell.”
And he kept on asking her, and left her no peace, but he could get nothing out of her.
At last he said, “If you will not tell it to me, tell it to the iron oven( 烤炉 ),” and went away.
Then she put her head into the iron oven, and began to cry, and at last she opened her heart and said,
“Here I sit, abandoned( 被抛弃 ) by all the world, even though( 尽管 ) I am a King’s daughter.
A wicked( 恶毒的 ) servant girl forced( 强迫 ) me to give up( 放弃 ) my royal clothing and my place at the Prince’s side.
Now I am a goose-girl, and have to do peasant’s work.
And if my mother knew, it would break her heart.”
Now the old King was standing outside by the oven door listening, and he heard all she said.
He called to her and told her to come out of the oven.
And he had her dressed in royal clothing, and was astonished( 惊讶的 ) to see how beautiful she was.
The old King then called his son.
He proved( 证明 ) to his son that he had the wrong bride( 新娘 ), who was really only a servant girl, and that his true bride was here, she who had been the goose-girl.
The Prince( 王子 ) was glad at heart when he saw her beauty and gentleness; and a great feast( 宴会 ) was made ready, and all the court people and their good friends( 朋友 ) were invited to it.
The bridegroom( 新郎 ) sat in the middle, with the Princess( 公主 ) on one side and the servant girl on the other.
The false( 假的 ) bride did not recognize( 认出 ) the true one, because she was so full of her pride in her own success.

When all the guests had eaten and drunk and were merry( 高兴的 ), the old King asked the false bride a question—namely, what someone deserved( 应受到（奖赏或惩罚） ), who had deceived( 欺骗 ) the King in such a way.
He told the whole story, changing only the names, and ended by asking,
“Now, what judgment( 审判 ) does such a person deserve?”
“This is my judgment,” answered the false bride.

“She deserves to be put naked( 赤裸的 ) into a barrel( 桶 ), studded( 被嵌钉 ) inside with sharp( 尖利的 ) nails( 钉子 ), and be dragged( 被拖动 ) along in it by two white horses from street to street, until she is dead.”
“You have spoken your own judgment,” said the old King. “As you have said, so shall it be done.”
And after the sentence had been carried out, the Prince married the true bride, and ever after they ruled over their kingdom in peace and happiness.

question.cn: 国王是怎么知道真相的？
question.en: How did the King know the truth?

options.cn: 国王听到了公主对铁烤炉说的话。
options.en: He heard what the Princess said to the iron oven.

analysis: 文中提到：“Now the old King was standing outside by the oven door listening, and he heard all she said. He called to her and told her to come out of the oven.”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 为什么假新娘没能认出真新娘？
question.en: Why didn’t the false bride recognize the true bride?

options.cn: 因为她把所有注意力都集中在王子身上。
options.en: Because she paid all attention to the Prince.

options.cn: 因为她太得意于自己的成功。
options.en: Because she was too proud of her success.

analysis: 文中提到：“The false bride did not recognize the true one, because she was so full of her pride in her own success.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 下列关于假新娘的说法中，哪一项是正确的？
question.en: Which of the following statements was true about the false bride?

options.en: She deserved to be punished severely.
She was driven away by the King.

analysis: 文中提到：“This is my judgment,” answered the false bride. “She deserves to be put naked into a barrel . . .  until she is dead.” “You have spoken your own judgment,” said the old King. “As you have said, so shall it be done.”因此答案选A。

question.en: Did Cinderella’s step-mother treat her well?

analysis: 由原文可知，Cinderella的继母让她做家务，做各种脏活累活，还百般刁难，不让她参加舞会，对待Cinderella非常不好，因此答案选B。

question.en: How did the girl get the name “Little Red-Cap”?

options.cn: 她妈妈给她取名为“小红帽”。
她外婆给她取名为“小红帽”。
她之所以叫“小红帽”是因为她总是带着一顶小红帽子。
options.en: She got the name because she wore a little red cap all the time.

analysis: 文中提到：“Once she gave her a little red cap, which suited her so well that she would never wear anything else; so she was always called “Little Red-Cap.””因此答案选C。

question.cn: 为什么要给Hansel做可口的食物？
question.en: Why was delicious food cooked for Hansel?

options.en: Because the witch liked Hansel more.

options.cn: 因为女巫想把他喂胖再吃掉。
options.en: Because the witch wanted make Hansel fat to eat.

analysis: 文中提到：“Hansel, put out your finger, that I may tell if you are fat enough yet.” 因此答案选B。

question.cn: 为什么国王邀请女巫来参加睡美人的生日宴会呢？
question.en: Why did the King invite the Wise Women to the feast for Sleeping Beauty’s birth?

options.en: Because he was afraid of these Wise Women.

options.cn: 因为他在睡美人出生前承诺过。
options.en: Because he made a promise before Sleeping Beauty’s birth.

options.cn: 因为他想让女巫给孩子赐福。
options.en: Because he wanted the Wise Women to bless the child.

analysis: 文中提到：“The King was so happy that he gave a great feast. He invited not only his friends and relations, but also the Wise Women, in order that they might bless the child.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 在什么条件下，这个人可以摘莴苣？
question.en: On what condition could the man have rampion?

options.en: He must pay for the rampion.

options.cn: 他必须把他即将出生的孩子给女巫。
options.en: He must give his soon-to-be-born child to the witch.
He must work for the witch.

analysis: 文中提到：““Then you may have as much rampion as you like, on one condition—the child that will come into the world must be given to me. It shall go well with the child, and I will care for it like a mother.” ”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 下列关于白雪公主的继母的说法中，哪一项是正确的？
question.en: Which of the following statements about Snow White’s step-mother was true?

analysis: 由原文可知，白雪公主的继母虽然美丽，但是多次暗害白雪公主，因此答案选C。

question.cn: 谁帮助磨坊主的女儿摆脱困境？
question.en: Who helped the miller’s daughter get out of the trouble?

analysis: 由原文可知，是侏儒怪帮助磨坊主的女儿把稻草变成了金子，摆脱困境，因此答案选B。

question.cn: 公主想和青蛙待在一起吗？
question.en: Did the Princess want to be with the frog?

analysis: 由原文可知，公主一开始就很讨厌丑陋的青蛙，在国王的命令下才跟青蛙待在一起的，因此答案选B。

question.cn: 从渔夫和他的妻子中，我们可以学到什么？
question.en: What can we learn from the fisherman and his wife?

options.en: We need to be content in life.

options.cn: 要采取一切办法获得权力。
options.en: We should take power in every way.

analysis: 由全文可知，渔夫的妻子因为贪婪最后导致一无所有，因此渔夫和他的妻子这篇故事告诉我们在生活中要懂得知足，适可而止，因此答案选A。

question.cn: 我们可以从“生命之水” 的故事里学到什么？
question.en: What can we learn from "The Water of Life"?

options.en: Virtue is always rewarded and evil punished.

analysis: “生命之水”这个故事里，小王子善良孝顺，英勇忠诚，和公主终成眷属，和国王重归于好；而两个邪恶的王子也流落在外，终身不能回归故里。从这个故事里，我们可以再次重温这句至理名言：善有善报恶有恶报，因此答案选C。
